name: OASEControl
0:
”Alexa, turn on AquaMax.”
”Alexa, start fountain scene 1.”

skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Manage everything easily and safely.
Using the OASE Control Skill in combination with Alexa, you can use your voice to operate your OASE Control-enabled pond and aquarium technology as well as biOrb EARTH. 
You can switch the following devices on and off or control the output of the pumps and dimmable sockets.
- FM-Master Cloud sockets
- Aquarius Eco Expert
- AquaMax Eco Expert
- AquaMax Eco Titanium
- AquaMax Eco Premium
- HighLine Premium LED

For the biOrb EARTH, you can activate the boost functions and sound, as well as check the current temperature and humidity values.

For example, you can say:

"Alexa, turn on fountain."
"Alexa, start fountain scene 1." 
"Alexa, dim Aquarius to 50%."
"Alexa, turn on socket 1."
"Alexa, dim socket 4 to 25%."
"Alexa, turn on aquarium lighting."
"Alexa, start rain boost."
"Alexa, start fog"
"Alexa, start sound from terrarium"
"Alexa, how warm is the terrarium?"
"Alexa, how humid in the terrarium?"


To set up this Skill:
Firstly, select "Launch Skill" in the Alexa app to link your OASE Control account and search for your devices. For more information on connecting Smart Home devices, see: 
Connect your Smart Home device with Alexa
https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=G3RKPNRKF33ECTW7

To use this Skill, you must specify the name of the devices to be used. These names can be specified using two methods:
• Use the names you have already specified. They are displayed in the OASE Control app and can be modified there.
• Create an Alexa group such as "Stream" or "Garden lighting" and add the device to the group. For more information, see: 
Creating a Smart Home device group 
https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=GS8URL9U6PW8SPTA

If you have any questions, please see the OASE Control FAQs at www.oase.com/faqs

We wish you a lot of fun with our OASE Control Skill!
Your OASE Team
